question_text: What are the common causes of boot failure and what should be your first troubleshooting steps?
answer_options: Always replace the motherboard first, then check connections
Check power connections, verify boot device connections, check BIOS boot order, listen for POST beep codes
Immediately run memory diagnostics and replace all RAM modules
Format the hard drive and reinstall the operating system
correct_answer: Check power connections, verify boot device connections, check BIOS boot order, listen for POST beep codes
explanation: Common causes include corrupted boot files, failed storage devices, incorrect boot order, or hardware failures. First steps: 1) Check power connections and ensure system powers on, 2) Verify boot device is properly connected, 3) Check BIOS/UEFI boot order settings, 4) Listen for POST beep codes that indicate hardware problems.
